MCQ: Who coined the term 'machine learning' in 1959?
Choices: a : Alan Turing | b : Arthur Samuel | c : Donald Hebb | d : Tom M. Mitchell

MCQ: What was the name of the experimental 'learning machine' developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a : Cyberdyne | b : Cybertron | c : Skynet | d : Matrix

MCQ: Who proposed the early mathematical models of neural networks to mirror human thought processes?
Choices: a : Warren McCulloch | b : Tom M. Mitchell | c : Donald Hebb | d : Walter Pitts

MCQ: What is the purpose of modern-day machine learning in classifying data?
Choices: a : To make predictions for future outcomes | b : To develop models | c : To recognize patterns | d : To communicate data

MCQ: According to Tom M. Mitchell, what is the definition of a computer program learning from experience?
Choices: a : Improving performance at tasks in T | b : Improving performance at tasks in P | c : Improving performance at tasks in E | d : Improving performance at tasks in T as measured by P
